turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Yellow-bellied sea snake.
turn.1: Why do yellow-bellied sea snakes slither?
turn.2: They are sometimes observed in large aggregations of thousands on the surface of the water in oceanic drift lines, which has been proposed as a strategy to catch prey.
turn.4: They hunt by floating on the surface of the water to attract pelagic fish that are seeking shelter; prey are captured via a backwards swimming motion and rapid lunge of the jaws.
turn.5: can you tell me more about how they hunt?
turn.6: The ability to swim backwards is an unusual and distinguishing characteristic of this species.
turn.7: do they use any other technique?
turn.8: Heatwole proposed that these snakes find their prey by sensing the vibration generated by fish movement.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The venom of this species is highly potent, like that of other sea snakes.
turn.12: The subcutaneous of the venom is 0.067 mg/kg and the venom yield per bite is 1.0–4.0 mg.
